outputs.output_descr:
The activities for 2014 in Private sector development will build on the success, experience and lessons learned from the support during previous few years in this area. After previous support yielded results in establishment of the PPP Unit in the Office of the President and general broad acceptance of international standards in PPPs across numerous MDAs, current work plan will target specifically capacity building of recently recruited staff of Sierra Leone PPP Unit and provision of the hands-on technical advice training on structuring particular Public Private Partnership transactions. In addition, the importance of social (corporate social responsibility based) partnerships will continue to be emphasised with specific deliverables on CSR framework and sensitisation activities. In addition, the financial sector activities will focus on increasing the capacity of the Bank of Sierra and in particularly the research department in carrying out policy analysis as well as supporting Financial Sector development plan Implementation Unit in the coordination and reporting multi-donor input in the Bank of Sierra Leone

These activities will directly contribute to the implementation of the strategic objectives of the Government provided for in the Agenda for Prosperity and in particular it's Resource Mobilisation Strategy. In particular, these activities will improve country's capacity to engage private sector in a more efficient way and negotiate PPP projects and better coordinate social PPP initiatives. Capacity building activities on PPP structuring will strengthen Government's abilities to leverage on private investment projects and increase employment opportunities, contribute to conflict prevention and local content policy objectives. The focus on strengthening PPP capacity at the local level will provide positive impact to local council abilities to engage the private sector thereby strengthening the decentralisation process and local economic development process. It will also increase financial service delivery to the unbanked urban and rural population. In addition, capacity building of the Financial sector Development will strengthen the Bank of Sierra Leone abilities to leverage policy analysis and formulation.
Aid Coordination and Implementation of the New Deal strengthened and the PRSP III planning, monitoring and evaluation

This projects aims to provide financial support to Bank of Sierra Leone (BOSL) through capacity building so as to promote financial inclusion, access to financial services by focusing on low income marginalized and vulnerable groups in urban and rural settings

In line with Sierra Leone's national priorities, and to contribute to achieving the Integrated Framework Goal of expanding the Country's  participation in the global economy by enhancing their economic growth and poverty reduction strategies, this Project aims at Developing an understanding and road map for future tourism, 2008-2015, that will review, formulate or promulgate relevant regulations and legislations that enhance sustainable tourism development and will identify shared strategic issues that the industry can resolve together;  Influencing the image of Sierra Leone as a tourist destination and Addressing the lack of unique tourist attractions.

Improved Capacity for Trade Information in Sierra Leone. The Project aims to empower public and private sector actors to identify and better take advantage of existing local, regional and international economic opportunities by addressing the shortfalls in trade information capacity within Sierra Leone.  The project impacts in 3 key areas. The first involves offering key stakeholders effective and relevant trade information through the new Sierra Leone Investment Export and Promotion Agency (SLIEPA). The second area involves upgrading the Ministry of Trade and Industry's (MTI) existing database of trade information and developing MTI's information management capacity. The final area is establishment of a national trade information network.

GoSL capacity to tender, analyze and negotiate Public Private Partnership (PPP) transactions further improved and technical support provided to specific PPP investment deals
Increased access to Financial Services by the unbanked rural and urban populations

Support to government management of the mineral sector for increased transparency efficiency and equity, including (a) development and national roll-out of official minerals cadastre system (b) high-level legal and technical assistance to the Presidential Task Force on minerals contract review and renegotiation (c) support to the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (EITI).

project_descr: INTEGRATED FRAMEWORK TOURISM PROJECT; Private sector Support Project; Aid Coordination Project
